newsitem.title: MEXICO: Bancomer sharply up in brisk late trade.
newsitem.headline: Bancomer sharply up in brisk late trade.

text.p: Shares listed by Bancomer, one of Mexico's largest financial groups, were sharply ahead in late afternoon trade on the local bourse.
Dealers and analysts said the stock had gained on heavy foreign buying fueled by a lower interest rate outlook in the wake of relatively peaceful elections.
Bancomer's B shares were up 38 centavos to 4.40 pesos, at heavy volume of 16.4 million shares, or 15 percent of all shares traded thus far.
"Bancomer is amazing; foreigners are buying it in droves," a desk trader said.

"As there were relatively few post-electoral problems, the outlook for domestic interest rates is downward, and that alleviates past-due loans burdens for banks in general," said Enrique Pani, a financial sector analyst at Deutsche Morgan Grenfell-Mexico.
Mexico voted on Sunday to renew the lower chamber of Congress, several state governors and, for the first time in modern history, Mexico City mayor.
Pani said Bancomer had long traded at a greater discount than could be justified with respect to competitor Banacci, in terms of price-to-book value multiples.
"Nevertheless, this discount should be well below its current level," Pani said.
